tags.name: Event
tags.description: This section outlines the APIs required to exchange and manage event information.

post.description: The Publish Event API is used to push notifications from OrbiPay to it's clients, via webhooks. OrbiPay sends notifications for a number of events ranging from bill due to payments. The clients who wish to consume these notifications need to specify the URL at which they want the notifications to be posted.

parameters.name: Event
parameters.description: An Event object is posted to the client as part of Publish Event. The Event object contains the domain object about which the notification is being sent, like Customer, Funding Account, File, Payment and Payment Setup.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the event being posted.

api_version.description: The number or reference to the version of the webhooks API.

timestamp.description: The timestamp, in the format MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm:ss:SSS z, for the moment when the event is posted to the client.

partner.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the client or partner consuming the Webhooks API.

allOf.description: The channel through which the API is invoked. For e.g., Online, VRU and Agent.

object.description: The actual object that goes in the data field would vary based on the type of event. The object could be any one of following, namely, [Payment](#the-payment-object), [PaymentSetup](#the-paymentsetup-object), [FundingAccount](#the-fundingaccount-object), [File](#the-file-object), [Customer](#the-customer-object).

pending_webhooks.description: The number of webhooks notifications that the client failed to process and that OrbiPay needs to resend.

source_type.description: The type of source that originated the event.

source_id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the source that originated the event. For e.g., The source_id is null or empty if the source_type is system. It is the id of the customer, if the source_type is customer and user login id if the source_type is user or external_user.

type.description: The type of the event that triggered the webhooks notification.

402.description: The parameters were valid but the request failed

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the event being posted.

api_version.description: The number or reference to the version of the webhooks API.

timestamp.description: The timestamp, in the format MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm:ss:SSS z, for the moment when the event is posted to the client.

partner.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the client or partner consuming the Webhooks API.

allOf.description: The channel through which the API is invoked. For e.g., Online, VRU and Agent.

object.description: The actual object that goes in the data field would vary based on the type of event. The object could be any one of following, namely, [Payment](#the-payment-object), [PaymentSetup](#the-paymentsetup-object), [FundingAccount](#the-fundingaccount-object), [File](#the-file-object), [Customer](#the-customer-object).

pending_webhooks.description: The number of webhooks notifications that the client failed to process and that OrbiPay needs to resend.

source_type.description: The type of source that originated the event.

source_id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the source that originated the event. For e.g., The source_id is null or empty if the source_type is system. It is the id of the customer, if the source_type is customer and user login id if the source_type is user or external_user.

type.description: The type of the event that triggered the webhooks notification.

object.description: The actual object that goes in the data field would vary based on the type of event. The object could be any one of following, namely, [Payment](#the-payment-object), [PaymentSetup](#the-paymentsetup-object), [FundingAccount](#the-fundingaccount-object), [File](#the-file-object), [Customer](#the-customer-object).

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the payment.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the payment.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the payment.

amount.description: The payment amount upto 2 decimal places.

fee_amount.description: The amount charged as fee for the payment.

fee_type.description: The way the fee is being charged to the customer. Fee could be added to the amount being paid, or, it could be charged later by the biller.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay.

confirmation_number.description: The confirmation number or reference provided to the payer for the successful payment.

allOf.description: The schedule type for the payment. For e.g., a one-time payment or a payment created based on an autopay setup.

payment_method.description: The fulfillment method for the payment.

payment_date.description: The date on which the payment is scheduled to be made. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_entry_date.description: The date on which the payment is captured in OrbiPay. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_return_date.description: The date on which a payment return is registered in OrbiPay, in the case of ACH payments. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD. This field is required in case of payment returns.

items.description: This object represents an instance of the refund. This object will be present only for the payments that are refunded.

id.description: The unique ID assigned by OrbiPay to the payment refund.

refund_fee.description: The fee amount being refunded. This would be the amount charged as fee for the original payment that is being refunded. This is applicable only in the case where the fee type is add_to_principal.

refund_date.description: The date on which the refund is processed. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_network_response.description: The response received either from ACH or Card networks.

payment_auth_code.description: The Auth Code returned by the card gateway. This is relevant only for card payments.

return_code.description: The ACH return code or the chargeback code received from Visa/Mastercard, in the event of returned payments.

return_code_desc.description: The text describing the ACH return or the chargeback received from Visa/Mastercard, in the event of returned payments.

payment_decline_code.description: The decline codes received from the card issuer or the card processor, in the event of declined card payments.

payment_decline_msg.description: The text describing the decline, from the card issuer or the card processor, in the event of declined card payments.

items.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the payment instance.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

items.description: This object represents the invoices that are associated with this payment instance. Only applicable for invoice payments.

id.description: The invoice number or the unique identifier assigned by Biller to the invoice.

amount.description: The invoice amount upto 2 decimal places.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay.

invoice_date.description: The date on which the invoice is generated by the biller. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

items.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the invoice.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the payer.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the payer.

first_name.description: The first name of the payer.

last_name.description: The last name of the payer.

middle_name.description: The middle initial of the payer.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the payer. It should be in the full-date format as per ISO8601, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

ssn.description: The SSN of the payer if the account holder is an individual or the tax ID, if the payer is a business.

locale.description: The language in which the payer wants the alerts and notifications from OrbiPay. This is to be specified in the locale ID format - the 5 character format, <ISO639 language_code>_<ISO3166 country_code>. For e.g., en_US indicates the language preference as US English, which is also the default value.

email.description: The email address of the payer.

home_phone.description: The home phone number of the payer.

work_phone.description: The work phone number of the payer.

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the payer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the payer.

payee.description: The benificiary of the transaction. Not applicable for bill payments.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the payee.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the payee.

first_name.description: The first name of the payee.

last_name.description: The last name of the payee.

middle_name.description: The middle initial of the payee.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the payee. It should be in the full-date format as per ISO8601, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

ssn.description: The SSN of the payee if the account holder is an individual or the tax ID, if the payee is a business.

locale.description: The language in which the payee wants the alerts and notifications from OrbiPay. This is to be specified in the locale ID format - the 5 character format, <ISO639 language_code>_<ISO3166 country_code>. For e.g., en_US indicates the language preference as US English, which is also the default value.

home_phone.description: The home phone number of the payee.

work_phone.description: The work phone number of the payee.

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the payee.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the payee.
The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the funding account.

account_number.description: The number or reference that a customer uses to identify the account. The account could be the customer's account with the biller or the funding account used to make a payment.

account_holder_name.description: The name as specified on the account.

nickname.description: The nickname by which a customer might want to identify the account.

issuer_name.description: The name of the authority that has issued the account. This is relevant only in the case of bank accounts.

aba_routing_number.description: The ABA/Routing number for the bank account.

allOf.description: The type of the funding account. For e.g., bank, credit card or debit card.
The sub type of the funding account. For e.g., a savings account, a checking account, a visa credit card or a visa debit card.

expiry_date.description: The expiry date for the funding account in the format MM/yy, if the funding account is a card account.

account_holder_type.description: The type of ownership for the funding account. For e.g., personal account indicated as P or corporate/business account indicated as B. This is applicable only in the case of bank accounts.

save_for_future_use.description: Specifies whether the funding account is to be saved for future use.

ach_eligible_flag.description: Indicates if the funding account can be debited vide ACH, in case the funding account is a Demand Deposit Account (DDA).

atm_eligible_flag.description: Indicates if the funding account can be debited vide the ATM Rail network, in case the funding account is a Debit Card.

card_bin_no.description: The Bank Identification Number (BIN) or the Issuer Identification Number (IIN) for the card. This is the first six digits of the card number.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase, for the card account. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay. This defaults to USD.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the funding account.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the customer account.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the customer account.

account_holder_name.description: The name as specified on the account.

nickname.description: The nickname by which a customer might want to identify the account.

account_number.description: The number or reference that a customer uses to identify the account. The account could be the customer's account with the biller or the funding account used to make a payment.

issuer_name.description: The name of the authority that has issued the account. This is relevant only in the case of bank accounts.

account_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the customer account.

current_balance.description: The current balance on the customers account with the biller.

current_statement_balance.description: The balance on the customers account with the biller as reported on the last statement.

minimum_payment_due.description: The minimum payment amount, as specified by the biller, that needs to be made against the customers account.

past_amount_due.description: The amount that is due from the past bills/statements on the customers account with the biller.

payment_due_date.description: The date by which the customer needs to clear the dues against the customer's account with the biller. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

items.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the account.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

PaymentNetworkResponse.description: The response received either from ACH or Card networks.

payment_auth_code.description: The Auth Code returned by the card gateway. This is relevant only for card payments.

return_code.description: The ACH return code or the chargeback code received from Visa/Mastercard, in the event of returned payments.

return_code_desc.description: The text describing the ACH return or the chargeback received from Visa/Mastercard, in the event of returned payments.

payment_decline_code.description: The decline codes received from the card issuer or the card processor, in the event of declined card payments.

payment_decline_msg.description: The text describing the decline, from the card issuer or the card processor, in the event of declined card payments.

Refund.description: This object represents an instance of the refund. This object will be present only for the payments that are refunded.

id.description: The unique ID assigned by OrbiPay to the payment refund.

refund_fee.description: The fee amount being refunded. This would be the amount charged as fee for the original payment that is being refunded. This is applicable only in the case where the fee type is add_to_principal.

refund_date.description: The date on which the refund is processed. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

PaymentScheduleType.description: The schedule type for the payment. For e.g., a one-time payment or a payment created based on an autopay setup.

ChannelType.description: The channel through which the API is invoked. For e.g., Online, VRU and Agent.

The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the payment setup.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the payment setup.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the payment setup.

payment_schedule.description: The schedule for the payments that are created as part of a payment setup like recurring payment or autopay.

allOf.description: The schedule type for the payment. For e.g., a one-time payment or a payment created based on an autopay setup.

recurring_type.description: The frequency of the payments created as part of a payment setup. Only applicable in case of recurring setup.

recurring_count.description: The maximum number of payments that can be created as part of a recurring payment setup.

recurring_payment_amount_type.description: The amount type that would be used to set the payment amount for payments created as part of a recurring payment or autopay setup. In the case of a recurring payment setup the payment amount could be fixed by the payer.

payment_start_date.description: The date on which the first payment will be drafted as part of a recurring payment setup.  This is to be specified in the ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_end_date.description: The date by which the last payment will be drafted as part of a recurring payment setup. This is to be specified in the ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_limit_amount.description: The upper limit for the payment amount in the case of recurring or autopay payments. Any amount above the limit will not be paid automatically as part of recurring payments and autopay.

confirmation_number.description: The confirmation number or reference provided to the customer for the payment setup. Every payment created as part of the setup would have the same confirmation number.

items.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the payment instance.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the payee.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay.

amount.description: The payment amount upto 2 decimal places.

fee_amount.description: The amount charged as fee for the payment.

fee_type.description: The way the fee is being charged to the customer. Fee could be added to the amount being paid, or, it could be charged later by the biller.

payment_method.description: The fulfillment method for the payment setup.

payment_date.description: The date on which the payment is scheduled to be made. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_entry_date.description: The date and time at which the payment is captured in OrbiPay. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_return_date.description: The date on which a payment return is registered in OrbiPay, in the case of ACH payments. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

return_code.description: The field represents ACH return code or Visa/Master chargeback code. Only applicable for returned payments.

PaymentSchedule.description: The schedule for the payments that are created as part of a payment setup like recurring payment or autopay.

allOf.description: The schedule type for the payment. For e.g., a one-time payment or a payment created based on an autopay setup.

recurring_type.description: The frequency of the payments created as part of a payment setup. Only applicable in case of recurring setup.

recurring_count.description: The maximum number of payments that can be created as part of a recurring payment setup.

recurring_payment_amount_type.description: The amount type that would be used to set the payment amount for payments created as part of a recurring payment or autopay setup. In the case of a recurring payment setup the payment amount could be fixed by the payer.

payment_start_date.description: The date on which the first payment will be drafted as part of a recurring payment setup.  This is to be specified in the ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_end_date.description: The date by which the last payment will be drafted as part of a recurring payment setup. This is to be specified in the ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_limit_amount.description: The upper limit for the payment amount in the case of recurring or autopay payments. Any amount above the limit will not be paid automatically as part of recurring payments and autopay.

Invoice.description: This object represents the invoices that are associated with this payment instance. Only applicable for invoice payments.

id.description: The invoice number or the unique identifier assigned by Biller to the invoice.

amount.description: The invoice amount upto 2 decimal places.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay.

invoice_date.description: The date on which the invoice is generated by the biller. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

items.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the invoice.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

InvoiceCustomField.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the invoice.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

TxnCustomField.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the payment instance.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

AccountCustomField.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the account.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the funding account.

account_number.description: The number or reference that a customer uses to identify the account. The account could be the customer's account with the biller or the funding account used to make a payment.

account_holder_name.description: The name as specified on the account.

nickname.description: The nickname by which a customer might want to identify the account.

issuer_name.description: The name of the authority that has issued the account. This is relevant only in the case of bank accounts.

aba_routing_number.description: The ABA/Routing number for the bank account.

allOf.description: The type of the funding account. For e.g., bank, credit card or debit card.
The sub type of the funding account. For e.g., a savings account, a checking account, a visa credit card or a visa debit card.

expiry_date.description: The expiry date for the funding account in the format MM/yy, if the funding account is a card account.

account_holder_type.description: The type of ownership for the funding account. For e.g., personal account indicated as P or corporate/business account indicated as B. This is applicable only in the case of bank accounts.

save_for_future_use.description: Specifies whether the funding account is to be saved for future use.

ach_eligible_flag.description: Indicates if the funding account can be debited vide ACH, in case the funding account is a Demand Deposit Account (DDA).

atm_eligible_flag.description: Indicates if the funding account can be debited vide the ATM Rail network, in case the funding account is a Debit Card.

card_bin_no.description: The Bank Identification Number (BIN) or the Issuer Identification Number (IIN) for the card. This is the first six digits of the card number.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase, for the card account. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay. This defaults to USD.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the funding account.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the customer.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

middle_name.description: The middle initial of the customer.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the customer. It should be in the full-date format as per ISO8601, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

ssn.description: The SSN of the customer if the customer is an individual or the tax ID, if the customer is a business.

locale.description: The language in which the payer wants the alerts and notifications from OrbiPay. This is to be specified in the locale ID format - the 5 character format, <ISO639 language_code>_<ISO3166 country_code>. For e.g., en_US indicates the language preference as US English, which is also the default value.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

home_phone.description: The home phone number of the customer.

work_phone.description: The work phone number of the customer.

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the customer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the customer.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the customer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the file received by or originated in OrbiPay.

file_name.description: The name of the file received by or originated in OrbiPay.

file_description.description: The description of the file received by or originated in OrbiPay.

total_debit_amount.description: The total amount to be debited as per the payment file originated in OrbiPay. This field is relevant only for payment files.

total_credit_amount.description: The total amount to be credited as per the payment file originated in OrbiPay. This field is relevant only for payment files.

total_record_count.description: The total number of records present in the file received by or originated in OrbiPay.

processed_record_count.description: The total number of records that got processed in the file received by OrbiPay. This field is relevant for the acknowlegement (ACK) files that OrbiPay sends in response to files received.

rejected_record_count.description: The total number of records that got rejected in the file received by OrbiPay. This field is relevant for the acknowlegement (ACK) files that OrbiPay sends in response to files received.

total_batches.description: The total number of batches in the batched file originated by OrbiPay, like NACHA File, Daily Activity File and Remittance File.

file_status.description: The status of the file received or sent by OrbiPay.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the customer.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

middle_name.description: The middle initial of the customer.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the customer. It should be in the full-date format as per ISO8601, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

ssn.description: The SSN of the customer if the customer is an individual or the tax ID, if the customer is a business.

locale.description: The language in which the payer wants the alerts and notifications from OrbiPay. This is to be specified in the locale ID format - the 5 character format, <ISO639 language_code>_<ISO3166 country_code>. For e.g., en_US indicates the language preference as US English, which is also the default value.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

home_phone.description: The home phone number of the customer.

work_phone.description: The work phone number of the customer.

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the customer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the customer.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the customer.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the customer.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

middle_name.description: The middle initial of the customer.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the customer. It should be in the full-date format as per ISO8601, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

ssn.description: The SSN of the customer if the customer is an individual or the tax ID, if the customer is a business.

locale.description: The language in which the payer wants the alerts and notifications from OrbiPay. This is to be specified in the locale ID format - the 5 character format, <ISO639 language_code>_<ISO3166 country_code>. For e.g., en_US indicates the language preference as US English, which is also the default value.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

home_phone.description: The home phone number of the customer.

work_phone.description: The work phone number of the customer.

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the customer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the customer.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the customer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the customer account.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the customer account.

account_holder_name.description: The name as specified on the account.

nickname.description: The nickname by which a customer might want to identify the account.

account_number.description: The number or reference that a customer uses to identify the account. The account could be the customer's account with the biller or the funding account used to make a payment.

issuer_name.description: The name of the authority that has issued the account. This is relevant only in the case of bank accounts.

account_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the customer account.

current_balance.description: The current balance on the customers account with the biller.

current_statement_balance.description: The balance on the customers account with the biller as reported on the last statement.

minimum_payment_due.description: The minimum payment amount, as specified by the biller, that needs to be made against the customers account.

past_amount_due.description: The amount that is due from the past bills/statements on the customers account with the biller.

payment_due_date.description: The date by which the customer needs to clear the dues against the customer's account with the biller. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

items.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the account.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the list of customer accounts belonging to the customer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the funding account.

account_number.description: The number or reference that a customer uses to identify the account. The account could be the customer's account with the biller or the funding account used to make a payment.

account_holder_name.description: The name as specified on the account.

nickname.description: The nickname by which a customer might want to identify the account.

issuer_name.description: The name of the authority that has issued the account. This is relevant only in the case of bank accounts.

aba_routing_number.description: The ABA/Routing number for the bank account.

allOf.description: The type of the funding account. For e.g., bank, credit card or debit card.
The sub type of the funding account. For e.g., a savings account, a checking account, a visa credit card or a visa debit card.

expiry_date.description: The expiry date for the funding account in the format MM/yy, if the funding account is a card account.

account_holder_type.description: The type of ownership for the funding account. For e.g., personal account indicated as P or corporate/business account indicated as B. This is applicable only in the case of bank accounts.

save_for_future_use.description: Specifies whether the funding account is to be saved for future use.

ach_eligible_flag.description: Indicates if the funding account can be debited vide ACH, in case the funding account is a Demand Deposit Account (DDA).

atm_eligible_flag.description: Indicates if the funding account can be debited vide the ATM Rail network, in case the funding account is a Debit Card.

card_bin_no.description: The Bank Identification Number (BIN) or the Issuer Identification Number (IIN) for the card. This is the first six digits of the card number.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase, for the card account. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay. This defaults to USD.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the funding account.
The URL that can be used to fetch the list of funding accounts belonging to the customer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the payment.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the payment.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the payment.

amount.description: The payment amount upto 2 decimal places.

fee_amount.description: The amount charged as fee for the payment.

fee_type.description: The way the fee is being charged to the customer. Fee could be added to the amount being paid, or, it could be charged later by the biller.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay.

confirmation_number.description: The confirmation number or reference provided to the payer for the successful payment.

allOf.description: The schedule type for the payment. For e.g., a one-time payment or a payment created based on an autopay setup.

payment_method.description: The fulfillment method for the payment.

payment_date.description: The date on which the payment is scheduled to be made. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_entry_date.description: The date on which the payment is captured in OrbiPay. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_return_date.description: The date on which a payment return is registered in OrbiPay, in the case of ACH payments. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD. This field is required in case of payment returns.

items.description: This object represents an instance of the refund. This object will be present only for the payments that are refunded.

id.description: The unique ID assigned by OrbiPay to the payment refund.

refund_fee.description: The fee amount being refunded. This would be the amount charged as fee for the original payment that is being refunded. This is applicable only in the case where the fee type is add_to_principal.

refund_date.description: The date on which the refund is processed. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

payment_network_response.description: The response received either from ACH or Card networks.

payment_auth_code.description: The Auth Code returned by the card gateway. This is relevant only for card payments.

return_code.description: The ACH return code or the chargeback code received from Visa/Mastercard, in the event of returned payments.

return_code_desc.description: The text describing the ACH return or the chargeback received from Visa/Mastercard, in the event of returned payments.

payment_decline_code.description: The decline codes received from the card issuer or the card processor, in the event of declined card payments.

payment_decline_msg.description: The text describing the decline, from the card issuer or the card processor, in the event of declined card payments.

items.description: This object represents User Defined Fields. Only applicable if one or more user defined fields exist for the payment instance.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

items.description: This object represents the invoices that are associated with this payment instance. Only applicable for invoice payments.

id.description: The invoice number or the unique identifier assigned by Biller to the invoice.

amount.description: The invoice amount upto 2 decimal places.

currency_code3d.description: The three-letter currency code in the ISO4217 format, in uppercase. It must be a currency supported by OrbiPay.

invoice_date.description: The date on which the invoice is generated by the biller. It must be in ISO8601 full-date format, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

id.description: The id for the user defined field.

value.description: The value of the user defined field.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the payer.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the payer.

first_name.description: The first name of the payer.

last_name.description: The last name of the payer.

middle_name.description: The middle initial of the payer.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the payer. It should be in the full-date format as per ISO8601, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

ssn.description: The SSN of the payer if the account holder is an individual or the tax ID, if the payer is a business.

locale.description: The language in which the payer wants the alerts and notifications from OrbiPay. This is to be specified in the locale ID format - the 5 character format, <ISO639 language_code>_<ISO3166 country_code>. For e.g., en_US indicates the language preference as US English, which is also the default value.

email.description: The email address of the payer.

home_phone.description: The home phone number of the payer.

work_phone.description: The work phone number of the payer.

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the payer.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the payer.

payee.description: The benificiary of the transaction. Not applicable for bill payments.

url.description: The URL that can be used to fetch the details of the payee.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier in the client system for the payee.

first_name.description: The first name of the payee.

last_name.description: The last name of the payee.

middle_name.description: The middle initial of the payee.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the payee. It should be in the full-date format as per ISO8601, namely, YYYY-MM-DD.

ssn.description: The SSN of the payee if the account holder is an individual or the tax ID, if the payee is a business.

locale.description: The language in which the payee wants the alerts and notifications from OrbiPay. This is to be specified in the locale ID format - the 5 character format, <ISO639 language_code>_<ISO3166 country_code>. For e.g., en_US indicates the language preference as US English, which is also the default value.

home_phone.description: The home phone number of the payee.

work_phone.description: The work phone number of the payee.

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the payee.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned by OrbiPay to the payee.
